title: At least 62 dead after South Korean jet crash-lands
byline: At least 62 people were killed when a passenger jet crash-landed at an airport in southwestern South Korea, the local fire department told CNN.

title: Mahout trampled by elephant during Dodanduwa perahera
byline: An elephant trampled its mahout during a temple procession in the Dodanduwa area of Galle last evening.

title: Former Minister Manusha’s brother remanded over alleged Rs. 3 Mn fraud
byline: Thisara Iroshana Nanayakkara, the brother of former Foreign Employment Minister Manusha Nanayakkara, has been ordered to be remanded till January 6, 2025, following his appearance before the Gampaha Magistrate’s Court.

title: Sri Lanka expresses condolences following Jeju Air tragedy
byline: The Government of Sri Lanka has extended its deepest sympathies following the tragic crash of Jeju Air flight 7C 2216 at Muan Airport in the Republic of Korea earlier today.

title: 179 people feared dead in South Korea plane crash
byline: A Jeju Air plane veered off the runway and collided with a fence in South Korea’s Muan city on Sunday. Out of the 181 passengers, 179 are feared killed. The authorities have so far confirmed 167 deaths from the accident.

title: Two workers drown at Matale Water Treatment Plant
byline: Two youths employed at the Matale Water Treatment Plant drowned in the Sudu Ganga yesterday (28), police said.

title: Customs clear 75,000 MT of imported rice
byline: The Sri Lanka Customs have cleared 75,000 metric tons of imported rice as of December 29, following the government’s move to allow rice imports without permits.

title: All sand mining activities banned in low-lying areas around Kelani Ganga
byline: A ban has been imposed on reclaiming low-lying land and activities like soil washing and sanding in the Kaduwela Municipal Council area to help prevent flooding from the Kelani Ganga.

title: Wanindu, Kusal Mendis, and Chamari nominated for ICC awards
byline: Sri Lankan cricketers Wanindu Hasaranga and Kusal Mendis have been shortlisted for the ICC Men’s ODI Cricketer of the Year award for 2024.

title: General Shavendra Silva bids farewell to active service
byline: General Shavendra Silva, the 8th Chief of Defence Staff (CDS) of Sri Lanka, will retire from his position and active service in the Sri Lanka Army on January 1, 2025.

title: Traffic restrictions on Colombo-Avissawella Road
byline: The Colombo-Avissawella road will be restricted to traffic from 9:00 PM today (29) till 1:00 AM tomorrow (30), the police said.
